ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained experience in many basic microbiology laboratory techniques. It grounded my learning in the microbiology lecture.
Lot of techniques pertaining to microbiology: staining, culturing, etc

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course expectations were clearly outlined in the syllabus, and there was an appropriate amount of work each week, even including the lab reports. As far as labs go, it was a very reasonable workload and warrants its half credit designation. During the lab period, the professor accurately communicated the amount of time each experiment would take and provided an overview of important information at the beginning of each meeting. One weakness is the lack of general lab practice information (i.e., how to sanitize your work station), which would be useful for students unfamiliar with lab work but hoping to pursue it in the future. However, the course in general had very few weaknesses.

I think Professor Hartman did an excellent job of designing lab experiments that allowed us to practice skills we had learned in microbiology lecture. She was always willing to clarify points of confusion and was very knowledgeable about all the experiments we performed. In the past I have taken some lab courses where the instructor/TF did not have complete understanding of the experiments being performed and couldn't answer questions effectively, so I appreciated having an instructor like Professor Hartman.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This is an excellent course for MCDB students interested in microbiology. It is also a good lab option for those hoping to fulfill the lab requirements without adding too much work to their course load; you are able to learn a lot, but much of it is during the actual lab period.
Yes, I think anyone interested in taking a biology lab or learning experimental techniques would enjoy this course
Yes! Take this lab. Everything about it is so cool.
Yes, It is a great class w/ not that much work. Professor Hartman is the best, you can tell she cares about the well-being of her students.
